title: VWAT Settlement Help for Newcomers to Canada
content: VWAT supports newcomers with housing, health care, schools, and more. We provide comprehensive settlement services including finding family doctors, getting health cards (OHIP), enrolling children in school, applying for newcomer benefits (Child Benefit, SIN), understanding immigration and PR documents, employment and housing support, sponsorship and citizenship applications, form filling and translation services, obtaining IDs and documents (PR, OHIP, driver's licence), counselling and referrals, and orientation to Toronto and Canadian life.

title: Finding a Family Doctor and Getting OHIP Card
content: VWAT can help you find a family doctor or health card. We assist newcomers with navigating the healthcare system and obtaining OHIP (Ontario Health Insurance Plan) cards. Contact us at 647-343-8928 ext. 116 to book an appointment with a settlement worker.

title: Enrolling Children in School
content: VWAT can help you enroll your children in school. We provide guidance on the school enrollment process in Toronto and Ontario, help with required documentation, and explain the Canadian education system. Call us at 647-343-8928 ext. 116 or book an appointment.

title: Applying for Newcomer Benefits
content: VWAT helps newcomers apply for benefits such as Child Benefit, SIN (Social Insurance Number), and OHIP. We assist with understanding eligibility, completing applications, and gathering required documentation. Services available in English and Vietnamese.

title: VWAT Employment Support Programs
content: VWAT offers free professional employment support from experienced employment counsellors. Services include: one-on-one employment counselling, resume writing and screening, interview preparation and mock interviews, job search support and matching, temporary placements, mentoring, licensure prep, networking opportunities, continuing education guidance, and volunteer opportunities. Employment services started in April 2020 and are IRCC-funded.
success_metrics: Resume writing services are free (IRCC-funded). Programs include Nail Tech Training Program, Food Handler's Certification, English for Employment, G1 Driver's Licence Study Support.

title: Job Search Support and Career Development
content: VWAT helps with job search including resume support, interview preparation, and job referrals. We provide one-on-one counselling, mock interviews, job matching, networking opportunities, and continuing education guidance. All services are free for eligible newcomers.
eligibility: Primarily newcomers; open consult with employment team

title: Skills Training Programs
content: VWAT offers free training programs including: Food Safety and Nail Technician skills training, English for Employment classes, G1 Driver's Licence Study Support, and various employment readiness workshops. Information about upcoming classes and programs can be found on our Events page or Blog page.

title: English Language Classes at VWAT
content: VWAT offers friendly, engaging English conversation circle classes that help newcomers practice and build confidence. We provide: ESL Conversation Groups (for Permanent Residents), English for Employment classes, in-person English conversation circles, and ESL for Seniors. We also help you book a YMCA Language Assessment session to get a referral for IRCC-funded LINC classes and find a class that fits your schedule - day, evening, weekend, online, or in-person.

title: VWAT English Conversation Classes
content: VWAT offers in-house English conversation circle classes for newcomers. These friendly classes help practice conversational English and build networking skills. Available for different skill levels from beginner to high-intermediate. Register through our Events page or contact us at 647-343-8928 ext. 116.
eligibility: Open to all newcomers; recommended for those seeking to improve daily communication and confidence in English

title: YMCA Language Assessment and LINC Referral
content: VWAT can help you book a Language Assessment session with YMCA to get a referral for IRCC-funded LINC (Language Instruction for Newcomers to Canada) classes. This assessment determines your English level and helps you find appropriate language training programs.

title: Government Forms and Tax Filing Assistance
content: VWAT assists newcomers with completing government forms and personal income tax filing. We help with: PR card renewal, driver's licence applications or renewals, birth/marriage certificates, translations, commissioner of oaths services, SIN applications, health card updates, school enrollment forms, citizenship applications, and other newcomer-related forms.

title: Help with Immigration and Government Forms
content: VWAT can assist you with completing a variety of government and immigration forms, including: PR card renewal, driver's licence applications or renewals, birth/marriage certificates, translations, commissioner of oaths services, SIN applications, health card updates, school enrollment forms, and other newcomer-related forms. All form-filling services are provided with translation support in Vietnamese.

title: Free Income Tax Clinic
content: VWAT has partnered with the Community Volunteer Income Tax Program (CVITP) since 2017 to offer a free income tax clinic in Toronto. Our experienced tax advisors provide guidance to make the process stress-free, helping you organize your documents and answer any questions. Service is available for individuals/families earning under $35,000-$52,500. For assistance with filing 2022 or earlier tax years, please select Thuy Nguyen. For 2023 or later tax years, you may choose any tax preparer.
partnership: Community Volunteer Income Tax Program (CVITP) since 2017

title: VWAT Programs and Services for Seniors
content: VWAT offers a variety of services to help seniors stay active, connected, and informed. Services include: assistance with OAS, GIS, CPP applications, Ontario Drug Benefit (under 65) assistance, Ontario Seniors Dental Care Program (65+) applications, Ontario Works (under 65) applications, Toronto Subsidized Housing applications, job search help, weekly fitness classes (Tai Chi, Zumba), neighbourhood walks, healthy eating and cooking classes, one-on-one appointments for benefits and housing, health and wellness resources, and volunteer opportunities.

contact.coordinator: Thu Le, VWAT Seniors Program Coordinator

title: Senior Programs and Activities
content: VWAT offers programs and activities designed for seniors, including social events, educational workshops, and community gatherings. Activities include: weekly fitness classes (Tai Chi, Zumba), neighbourhood walks, healthy eating and cooking classes, technology training, and financial guidance. Information about upcoming programs can be found on our Events page or Blog page.
eligibility: Seniors in Toronto; certain benefits have age/income requirements

title: Wellness Support and Social Benefits for Seniors
content: VWAT can connect seniors with wellness support, health information, and assistance with social benefits applications including: OAS (Old Age Security), GIS (Guaranteed Income Supplement), CPP (Canada Pension Plan), Ontario Works, ODSP (Ontario Disability Support Program), subsidized housing, Ontario Drug Benefit, and Ontario Seniors Dental Care Program. We also provide elder abuse prevention, emergency preparedness information, and caregiver supports.

title: VWAT Youth Programs and Activities
content: VWAT offers activities, workshops, and resources to help newcomer youth stay engaged, develop skills, and connect with the community. Programs include: Youth Group (leadership, volunteering, workshops, mentorship), Summer Day Camp (leadership development, CSJ-funded roles), cultural festival volunteering (Lunar New Year, Trung Sisters, Children's Lantern Festival), recreational activities, field trips, arts and crafts, leadership and communication workshops, and critical discussions on racism, bullying, and mental health. Youth can earn volunteer hours for graduation.
eligibility: Youth approximately 13-25 years old. Newcomers prioritized but open to broader community

title: Youth Workshops and Social Events
content: VWAT offers workshops, mentorship programs, and social events for youth including: leadership sessions, volunteer projects, recreational activities, field trips, arts and crafts, workshops on leadership, communication, and goal-setting, and critical discussions on racism, bullying, and mental health. Information about upcoming programs can be found on our Events page or Blog page.

title: Career and Skills Support for Youth
content: VWAT helps youth develop career and workplace skills, including: job search support, resume building, interview preparation, mentorship opportunities, employment workshops, skill development sessions, and volunteer experience. These programs help youth develop transferable skills for future careers and build supportive networks with community and peers.

title: Volunteer Opportunities and Community Events
content: VWAT offers opportunities for newcomers, youth, and community members to get involved, share skills, and connect with others. We provide volunteer opportunities (assisting with programs, events, workshops), and host community events throughout the year. We also welcome community partners, agencies, and employers who want to collaborate - whether it's co-hosting workshops, hiring newcomer staff, or posting job opportunities on our VWAT Job Board.

title: Volunteer with VWAT
content: VWAT provides volunteer opportunities for those looking to give back to the community, gain experience, or develop skills. Opportunities include assisting with programs, events, workshops, cultural festivals, and more. Youth can earn volunteer hours for graduation. To volunteer with us, fill out the volunteer form on our website. Information about upcoming volunteer opportunities can be found on our Events page or Blog page.

title: VWAT Community Events and Cultural Celebrations
content: VWAT hosts a variety of community events throughout the year, celebrating culture, learning, and connection. Events include: Multiculturalism Day Celebration, Mid-Autumn Children's Festival, Lunar New Year/Táº¿t Celebration, Trung Sisters Commemoration, and Indigenous-newcomer community connection events. Information about upcoming events can be found on our Events page or Blog page.

title: Employer Partnerships and Job Postings
content: VWAT welcomes partnerships with employers looking to hire newcomers or post job opportunities. You can submit your job posting or explore hiring support on our Post a Job page. We help connect employers with skilled newcomer candidates and provide support throughout the hiring process.

title: Community Organization Partnerships
content: VWAT welcomes partnerships with community organizations and agencies interested in collaborating on programs, workshops, or community initiatives. This could include co-hosting programs, offering training, or running community initiatives. To discuss partnership opportunities, contact Thuy Nguyen, Manager, Settlement & Employment Services, at 647-343-8928 ext. 112.

title: VWAT Contact Information
content: Vietnamese Women's Association of Toronto (VWAT) Family Services. Main phone: 647-343-8928 ext. 116. General email: info@vwat.org. Employment services: employment@vwat.org. Youth programs: youth@vwat.org. Senior programs coordinator: Thu Le (tle@vwat.org, ext. 116). Manager, Settlement & Employment Services: Thuy Nguyen (tnguyen@vwat.org, ext. 112). Website: https://www.vwat.org. We aim to respond within 1 to 2 business days.

title: About Vietnamese Women's Association of Toronto (VWAT)
content: VWAT (Vietnamese Women's Association of Toronto) Family Services provides free settlement and employment services, as well as programs for newcomers, youth, and seniors in Toronto. Founded to support the Vietnamese community, VWAT now serves all eligible clients. Services are available in English and Vietnamese. VWAT has been partnering with various organizations and government agencies to provide comprehensive support to newcomers since its establishment.
focus: Vietnamese community but serves all eligible clients

title: Languages Available at VWAT
content: VWAT services are available in English and Vietnamese. We provide translation services (English-Vietnamese) for forms and documents. For French language services, we can refer you to Centre Francophone du Grand Toronto (+1-416-922-2672, https://ac.centrefranco.org/).
